body:
Superseded by #11981 .
Alternative to #7862.

This approach allows for the definition of no-source -- or bundle -- packages that contain no source (or code) of their own to install; rather, they are used to encapsulate a set of dependencies.

TODO:
- [x] Rename `DependenciesPackage` to `BundlePackage` (see #7862)
- [x] Re-run `xsdk`
- [x] Add unit tests
- [x]  Fix `spack info` (and ensure it "works" for `BundlePackage`s (e.g., `xsdk`)

UPDATE:
- Alternative approach with minimal impact on `Package` with `BundlePackage`-related changes in/moved to PR #11981
- Basic template tests -- not of `BundlePackage` -- moved to separate PR #11970 
- `uninstall_by_spec` error tests moved to separate PR #11971 
- Extra `possible_dependencies` checks (for coverage) moved to separate PR #11988
title: Preliminary no-source package support (using inheritance)
